result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle A Hoppa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the jail sentence may be served with huber.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.

miscConds.notes:
-Domestic Violence Assessment and any follow-up.
-No Violent Contact with the victim.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year (05/10/2018)

1:04 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Kari Stockwell present in court.  FTP $543.00.  Statement by the defendant.  Statement by Agent Stockwell - will extend for one year.  Court finds the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for 1 year.  Court informs defendant that if not paid by the next discharge date the court will fashion conditions to include jail time.

Court adjourned at 1:06 p.m.
Probation review hearing on April 17, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Michelle A Hoppa
Current: 352 Monroe St, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 01-06-2017)
Prior: 554 SW Ceresco St, Berlin, WI 54923 United States

11:59 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - upon plea to count 1, count 2 will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

30 days county jail, with huber stayed and places the defedant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Domestic Violence Assessment and any follow-up.
-No Violent Contact with the victim.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel if sentence is served.

Court adjourned at 12:06 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 10, 2016 at 11:30 am.

2:45 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - spoke with the defendant and defendant is requesing to meet to discuss the offer.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on May 10, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:45 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-15-2016 02:30 pm

2:16 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - just received Discovery and need to review it.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on March 15, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:17 p.m.

8:57 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Violent Contact with Raleigh W.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on December 15, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:59 a.m.

Defendant called to inform us that she is a crossing guard and can't leave to get here until 8:45 a.m. and her case needs to be called after that.
